alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 10:35AM PDT until March 23 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet with dangerous rip currents and flooding of sea water over low lying coastal areas. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 11 PM PDT Thursday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 3 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Coastal flooding is possible over low-lying coastal areas such as beach parking lots and bike paths around the time of high tide. This includes the Pierpont Beach area. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tides of 6.0 to 6.5 feet MLLW are expected around 11am and 11pm.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
